questions.text: Health robustness to absorb setbacks without cascade failure is ...

answers.4: solid — I can absorb significant setbacks
answers.5: robust — my health has real shock absorbers
answers.2: weak — small issues become big problems
answers.3: moderate — I can handle minor setbacks
answers.1: fragile — any setback cascades into crisis

questions.text: My recovery speed from illness or injury is ...

answers.4: good — I bounce back fairly quickly
answers.5: fast — my body has resources to heal quickly
answers.2: below average — I take longer than most

questions.text: My overall wellness creating capacity for life is ...
questions.principle: Health is enabling, not just absence of disease

answers.4: enabling — my health supports my goals
answers.5: multiplying — wellness is a genuine asset
answers.2: constraining — health issues hold me back
answers.3: neutral — health neither helps nor hurts much
answers.1: limiting — my health restricts what I can do

questions.text: Preventive care and maintenance paying dividends is ...

answers.4: clear — my investments are paying off
answers.5: substantial — years of care yielding significant returns
answers.3: starting — beginning to see some benefits

questions.text: Integration of body, soul, spirit creating synergy is ...

answers.4: substantial — good integration most of the time
answers.5: deep — each area multiplies the others
answers.3: partial — some areas support each other
answers.1: absent — the areas drag each other down

remediation.advice: Health reserves are built through all previous layers: order (believing health follows patterns), causality (seeing cause-effect), responsibility (owning your health), discipline (consistent practices), and skill (knowing what works). If reserves are low, trace back to find the weak link.

scripture.text: And the God of peace will sanctify you completely, and may your whole spirit and soul and body be kept blameless.
